intro: Erodiophyllum acanthocephalum, commonly known as the rough-hairy erodium, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems covered in dense, glandular hairs. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Erodiophyllum acanthocephalum is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
